page.title: 13Shopping Survey (Aldridge)
page.content: We conducted a shopping survey with the help of parents at our school. 178 families replied. We found that many families shopped 3 times a week. The results of the question, "How do you travel to the shops?" were surprising. 10 went by bus, 64 walked and 123 went by car. We decided that car parks were good in the village and mothers preferred to put their heavy groceries straight into the car. Only 7 people travelled further than 3 miles into Aldridge, 28 lived between 2 and 3 miles away while 143 lived 1 mile or under from the shopping precinct. Over two thirds of the people asked shopped in Aldridge mainly for food. 163 families chose to shop in Aldridge because it was convenient to get to, only 1 person thought Aldridge was a cheap place to shop. Most went outside the area to buy furniture and clothes.
